N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 193.4 - Conditions of employment

State Regulations
(a) All
places in which the juveniles are working shall be constructed, equipped, arranged, operated and conducted so as to provide reasonable and adequate
protection for their lives, health and safety. (b) Such employment may include, but is not
limited to: (1)
general cleanup; (2)
minor repairs; (3)
routine clerical duties; (4)
beautification of grounds. (c) All participating juveniles
shall obtain employment certificates and shall be afforded, at school district
expense, coverage under the Workers' Compensation Law. All conditions of work
shall meet the standards prescribed in the Labor Law, including wages. Juveniles employed in restitution projects shall not be used to replace regular
employees. (d) Assigned duties
shall not interfere with the juvenile's regular instructional
program. Notes
